The prime minister is set to visit Scotland later, but there are murmurings of discontent among his MPs. 7 hrs ago Scotland Politics Seven health boards given £230m bailout loans despite record funding Despite record levels of NHS funding, seven health boards needed government help to balance their books last year. 7 hrs ago Scotland Scottish energy firms invest £5.4bn as part of UK grid upgrade Energy regulator Ofgem has approved a £28bn UK investment in a five-year plan to improve electricity and gas grids. 29 mins ago Scotland Scotland superfan books 22 hotels before World Cup draw Daris Nesbitt, 24, wasn't born the last time the men's team played in the World Cup finals in 1998. 7 hrs ago Glasgow & West Scotland Why people can struggle to live in the places they love Finding an affordable home is seen as one of the major challenges to rural living in Scotland. 55 mins ago Highlands & Islands Elves at Royal Mail hub sort letters to Santa Across the festive season, the Royal Mail organise hundreds of thousands of letters to Father Christmas GB Energy plan to focus on historical oil and gas areas The new publicly-owned body says its investments will aim to support 10,000 jobs by 2030. Edinburgh tourist tax to fund almost 500 affordable homes It is the first planned spend from the £50m expected to be raised annually from the Edinburgh visitor levy. US Girl Scout selling family's valuable painting to help Highland museum Amelia Cimbalo hopes to raise thousands of pounds for the West Highland Museum in Fort William. Drones drop tree seeds to help protect reservoir More than two million seeds are being sown to help protect water quality at the Talla Reservoir. Features and analysis Priced out? The cost of the World Cup How FIFA’s dynamic pricing could be putting off fans. Is upgrading an old skating pond worth £1m? A hybrid project for Helensburgh skating pond has been proposed, providing ecological benefits. Major: The dog who guided me through eight years of  TV and radio BBC Scotland's Ian Hamilton looks back on his partnership with his guide dog Major who has retired. 'Scotland qualifying for the World Cup put me in hospital' The BBC's entertainment correspondent Colin Paterson needed surgery after a mishap ahead of Scotland's World Cup qualifying game. Your pictures of Scotland A selection of photographs submitted to BBC Scotland News from around the country this week. News from around Scotland Edinburgh tourist tax to fund almost 500 affordable homes It is the first planned spend from the £50m expected to be raised annually from the Edinburgh visitor levy. Why people can struggle to live in the places they love Finding an affordable home is seen as one of the major challenges to rural living in Scotland. GB Energy plan to focus on historical oil and gas areas The new publicly-owned body says its investments will aim to support 10,000 jobs by 2030. Council 'did not get it right' over school relocation Plans to move a Borders primary are dropped after hearing "loud and clear" that parents opposed it. Retired teacher sentenced for abusing girls at residential school Patricia Robertson, 77, assaulted and humiliated girls at Fornethy House between 1969 and 1984. Sport What's on Nancy's Celtic to-do list? Wilfried Nancy has completed his long-waited move from Columbus Crew to Celtic, but what will be the new manager's priorities in Glasgow? Did we get too excited, too soon about Hearts? Hearts' eight-point lead at the top of the Scottish Premiership has evaporated. So what has happened? 'Excitement and nerves' for Archibald as Games loom Katie Archibald has already competed in a Commonwealth Games in Glasgow and is eager to do so again next summer. O'Neill leaves with Celtic's thanks as well as a new tracksuit Martin O'Neill leaves with one final performance after Celtic's grand old showman departs the stage. Rangers' Fernandez in new handball controversy... what happened this time? BBC Scotland examines two key incidents in the Scottish Premiership draw at Tannadice. More news on iPlayer and Sounds Reporting Scotland Big stories from across the country Radio Scotland Breakfast Wake up to the stories that matter from across Scotland and the world. Reporting Scotland More from the day’s top stories and communities across Scotland. Scotcast The BBC's Scottish news podcast.
